topic:
:rotating_light:BETA USERS:rotating_light: Provide feedback, challenges, issues with the new drag-n-drop editor in beta.
Beta sign up: <https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSfyp9mMckWylCsVv2fpdbB3FTnLDoYBOk-pyXjszoARek-L8w/viewform?usp=sf_link>
text:
set the channel topic: :rotating_light:BETA USERS:rotating_light: Provide feedback, challenges, issues with the new drag-n-drop editor in beta.
Beta sign up: <https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSfyp9mMckWylCsVv2fpdbB3FTnLDoYBOk-pyXjszoARek-L8w/viewform?usp=sf_link>

Hey team, we understand the design manager is in Beta, but when customers are used to their drag and drop templates and the v1 modules are forced to be upgraded to be v2 modules in order be edited and to work with other more recent features of HubSpot and the new design manager - us developers are in a catch 22.

We upgrade the modules and things break and there is no solution to fix it. Recommendations from support have not helped because the customHMTL module in the DaD editor strips out all third party code (i.e. IDX feeds for real estate via <script> .js files). The client doesn’t understand why it doesn’t work now or why they are forced to learn html now in order to update their website that used to be using DaD.

We believe it is an issue with the new design manager - specifically the drag and drop editor.

We can clone the drag and drop template to a HubL coded template and then hard code the IDX widget into plain hubL template, but this is not ideal and the client or their team of marketers can’t edit easily.

Has anyone run into a similar issue? And can this be solved QUICKLY?
Hey <@U26CZR9MW>, thanks for reporting. Just to make sure we notify the right people, are you talking about the drag and drop _template_ editor and not the drag and drop _page_ editor?
Also, when you have a moment, can you send me your Hub ID?

Related to v1 and v2 modules... this recently was released... making sure folks have this top of mind when thinking about options: <https://designers.HubSpot.com/blog/now-live-edit-legacy-modules-in-the-new-design-manager-and-enhanced-hubl-validation>
